card.name: Ancient Foes
card.text: Factions of the following types gain +1 prowessif in battle with an opposing faction of the corresponding pair: Orc and Elf; Troll and Ent; Man and Dúnadan. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Axes of the Dwarves
card.text: All Dwarf factions receive +1 prowess in battles with Dragon and Orc factions. Additionally, if a Dragon faction is wounded in battle with one of your Dwarf factions, you may remove this card from play to eliminate the Dragon faction.

card.name: Azanulbizar
card.text: Playable if you have at least three Dwarf factions in Redhorn Gate. Wounded Orc factions must participate in faction battles against your Dwarf factions. This card is worth 1 mp for each Orc faction you eliminate (place them with this card); it is worth full mp to a Dwarf-lord player. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Banners of the Lord
card.text: Playable on a character with a home site in a home region of one of your factions in play. +1 to body. Discard during the site phase if there is no such faction in the character’s current region. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Burdensome Commands
card.text: Playable on a non-avatar character if your opponent has a mustering card in play. -2 to the character’s mind, -1 to EI and -1 to prowess (all to a minimum of 1). Discard this card when target character is the recipient of any healing effect. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: By Mountain Paths
card.text: Playable on a faction. If you are a black player, target faction may treat Gorgoroth and Udûn as adjacent to Horse Plains, Dagorlad, Ithilien, Harandor, and Khand. If you are a white player, target faction may treat Rohan and Anórien as adjacent to Anfalas and Lamedon.

card.name: Chance by Arms
card.text: White player only. Playable on The One Ring. For each unwounded faction you have in play in Southern Mirkwood, Dagorlad, or at The Under- forges, the hazard limit is reduced by one against the bearer’s company (to no minimum). Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Coat of Fine Diamonds
card.text: Your Dragon factions cannot not be eliminated by faction battles. Your Dragon factions heal during your untap phase. Discard if any of your Dragon factions attacks in a faction battle.

card.name: Come Forth!
card.text: Playable on a faction that can move but is not moving. If target faction can legally do so it must now move to one of your factions’ current region (opponent’s choice).

card.name: Cowardice
card.text: Playable on a defending faction in a faction battle before dice are rolled. Target faction must move to a region adjacent to its current region. This prevents it from participating in the faction battle. You may bring this card from your sideboard to your play deck (reshuffle) if your opponent has a mustering card in play. You may bring this card from your discard pile to your play deck (rehuffle) when one of your factions is wounded.

card.name: Dark is the Hour
card.text: Playable on a unique faction not in its home region. -1 to target faction’s prowess when attacking in faction battles. Discard if target faction initiates and wins a faction battle. Cannot be duplicated on a given faction.

card.name: Deep Barracks
card.text: Playable on a protected Wizard-haven [H]. Your factions in this region may not be attacked and are considered to be at an Under-deeps site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Devourer of Hosts
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Hunting mode. Playable on your Dragon- lord, if any mustering card is in play. Returnthis card to your hand when you play another mode card, or during the organization phase if you so choose. Your Dragon-lord may use region movement (to a maximum of three regions), if moving to a site in the current region of one of opponent’s factions. During the site phase, instead of entering the site, the Dragon-lord may initiate a faction battle as if he were a faction with 5 mp. You receive any eliminated faction as Gathered Bones.

card.name: Devouring Wyrms
card.text: Attacks from ahunt Dragon manifestationsaffect any factions moving through a region affected by such a manifestation. Treat such an attack as a faction battle; the ahunt Dragon has a base prowess equal to its kill mp and the hazard player makes its roll. Any moving factions affected by target ahunt Dragon defend in the same battle. If the defending faction(s) wins, the ahunt Dragon is discarded.

card.name: Drive away the Night
card.text: Playable during the site phase on an Under-deeps site ifyou have a faction there. Your factions at the site initiatea faction battle against each of the site’s automatic- attacks; these have a base value equal to their prowess -5. The site’s type moves one step closer to a Free-hold [F]. Discard if you do not have an unwounded faction at the site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Dwarven Warhosts
card.text: Playable if you have a mustering card and a Dwarf faction in play. Your Dwarf factions may use Under-deeps movement. If you control a Dwarf character with mind 8 or more, your Dwarf factions receive +2 prowess in faction battles against Orcs. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Endurance of Stone
card.text: When a Dwarf faction would otherwise be eliminated, opponent must make a roll; if the result is less than 8 the faction is not eliminated (and is wounded). Discard when a Dwarf faction is eliminated.

card.name: Every Arrow Loosed
card.text: All Elf factions receive +1 to faction battles in Wilderness [w] regions. Additionally, Elf factions receive a +1 modifier in faction battles where they are defending. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Eye Ever Vigilant
card.text: Unique. Sauron specific. Playable if you havea mustering card in play. All your factions receive +1 prowess in faction battles.

card.name: Fearful Sun
card.text: Environment. If Doors of Night is in play,hero factions may move 1 less region. If Gates of Morning is in play, minion factions may move 1 less region. Once this card is in play it is considered neither a resource nor a hazard. Cannot not be duplicated.

card.name: Feast on Flesh
card.text: +2 to the roll for any faction battle in which oneof your Orc or Troll factions is attacking. Additionally, for each of opponent’s factions your eliminate in a faction battle, one of your factions may heal. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Fell Captain
card.text: Command. Playable on a leader. Return any other command card on the leader to your hand. +1 to the prowess of any faction of the same race in the leader’s current region (+2 if in the faction’s home region). Additionally, the leader may tap to have one of your factions in his region participate in a faction battle in an adjacent region.

card.name: Filled with Fury
card.text: Magic. Spirit-magic. Playable on a spirit-magic- using character, if you have a faction in the same region as his current region (or at the same site). Place this card with the faction. Target faction receives +2 prowess when attacking in faction battles and may not choose to not participate in faction battles. Unless he is a Ringwraith, character makes a CC modified by -4. Cannot be duplicated on a given faction.

card.name: Flung into the Fray
card.text: Command. Playable on a leader during the organization phase. Return all other command cards on target leader to your hand when this card is played. -2 to leader’s EI. Your wounded factions in the leader’s current region (or at his current site) are considered non-wounded during faction battles (but can still be eliminated).

card.name: Forth Eorlingas!
card.text: Playable before dice are rolled in a faction battle, if you have a Man faction involved in the battle with Gap of Isen or Rohan as a home region. Wound an opposing faction participating in the battle.

card.name: Herald of Gil-galad
card.text: Playable on an Elf-leader. Any Elf faction you control may use region movement to move to the leader’s current region.

card.name: Hosts of Isengard
card.text: Unique. Saruman specific. Playable if you have a mustering card in play. Your minion Man, Orc, and Wolf factions are worth full mp.

card.name: Hosts of the West
card.text: Playable if you have in play at least two Dúnadan, Elf, or Man factions currently worth 3 mp or more (the factions must be of different types). Any such faction suffers no reduction in their mp for being wounded. Discard if you do not control a Dúnadan, Man, or Elf faction worth at least 3 mp.

card.name: Lands Reclaimed
card.text: Playable on a faction not in its home region. The faction’s current region type becomes one step closer to a Free-domain [f]. Discard if the faction moves. May not be duplicated for a given region.

card.name: Lands Untended
card.text: Playable on a faction’s home region, if the faction is in play and not in the region (or at a site therin). The region’s type moves one step closer to a Wilderness [w]. Discard if a faction with target region as its home region is in the region. Cannot be duplicated on a given region.

card.name: Last Stand of Battle
card.text: Playable on a faction in their home region.+3 to faction battles. Discard if target faction moves to another region. Cannot be duplicated on a given faction or by a given player in a given region.

card.name: Lesser Brood
card.text: Playable at any tapped or untapped site with a Spawn automatic-attack if the influence check is greater than 5 May also be played at any untapped site with a Spider automatic-attack (modify the influence attempt by -3). If you have a unique Spider faction or ally in play this faction may move using region and Under-deeps movement.

card.name: Love next to Kin
card.text: Playable on an Elf or Man faction, if you have in play an animal faction played at a site in the same region. Place the animal faction with this card: both factions are considered one single faction. Their faction region movement is increased by 1. Additionally, this faction may move before any company’s movement/hazard phase. Cannot be duplicated on a faction.

card.name: Lure of Conquest
card.text: Corruption. Playable on opponent’s avatar if he has a mustering card in play. Target avatar receives 1 CP for each faction he has in play that is not in its home region. Target avatar makes a CC whenever an opposing faction is eliminated. Whenever one of target player’s factions is wounded or eliminated, he may make a roll: if the result is greater than 8, discard this card.

card.name: Lust of Battle
card.text: Playable on an Orc or Troll faction if you havea mustering card in play. Target faction may move an extra region this turn, if moving to a region where an opponent’s faction is located.

card.name: Númenór's Legacy
card.text: Playable on a Dúnadan faction with a home region that is a Coastal Sea [c] or region adjacent. For its movement, target faction may move to any such region. Cannot be duplicated on a given faction. Discard if the faction is wounded.

card.name: Old Alliances
card.text: Playable if you have a mustering card in play. Your factions that are worth full mp to you may move using region movement.

card.name: Old Grievance
card.text: Playable if your opponent is a hero playerand has a mustering card in play. Your factions may initiate faction battles against opponent’s factions this turn.

card.name: Pitiless Deeds
card.text: Instead of initiating a faction battle, a player may wound a faction in a region to wound one of opponent’s factions in a region.

card.name: Places of Safety
card.text: Elf-lord and non-Fallen-wizard only. Opposing factions worth less than 4 mp may not move to Lindon, Rhudaur, Wold & Foothills or Anfalas. Your factions may move 2 regions per turn if moving towards the closest of the above named regions. You may bring this card from your sideboard into your play deck (reshuffle) if your opponent has a mustering card in play.

card.name: Positively Hasty
card.text: Playable on an Ent or Awakened Plant faction, if your opponent controls an Orc or Troll faction in the faction’s home region or a region adjacent. Target faction may move using region movement to the aforementioned regions, and gains a +4 prowess in faction battles with Orc or Troll factions.

card.name: Prudent Counsel
card.text: All your garrisonned factions and factions in their home region receive +1 prowess when defending in a faction battle. You may bring this card from your sideboard to your play deck and shuffle, if your opponent has played a mustering card. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Rich Reward of Aid
card.text: Fallen-wizard only. Playable if you have three or more unique factions in Southern Mirkwood or Gorgoroth (none may be wounded). Discard if these requirements are not met. You may treat all versions of Dol Guldur, Barad-dûr, Carn Dûm, and Geann-a-lisch as Wizardhavens [H] for the purposes of healing and playing characters. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Ride to The World's Ending
card.text: Playable on a faction, if you have a characterwith a EI bonus against it at a site in the same region. Double the faction’s mp for the purpose of faction battles this turn. Unless the character is a leader, wound the faction at the end of the turn (or eliminate it if already wounded).

card.name: Run while Night Lasts!
card.text: Playable on an untapped leader after initiatinga faction battle in his current region (before rolls are made). Tap the leader and wound one of your factions. If you win the faction battle, the leader may take control of a non-special item which you must play from hand.

card.name: Setting up on His Own
card.text: Mustering card. Your factions which are of the same race as your avatar may use region movement. If you are Saruman, your Orc, Troll, Wolf, and minion Man factions may use region movement and Under-deeps movement. If you are Pallando, your Dúnadan, Hobbit, Man, Orc and Troll factions may use region movement.

card.name: Spiders of Mirkwood
card.text: Unique. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 12.Modifications: eliminate a character or Prisoner from the company to add a bonus to the roll equal to the eliminated character’s mind. If you have a mustering card in play, this faction may move to any region in Mirkwood.

card.name: Stone-Hewing
card.text: Unique. Gandalf or Radagast specific. Playableif you have a mustering card in play. Your Animal, Eagle, Awakened Plant, and Ent factions may move using region movement and have no restricted regions. This card is worth -1 mp for every eliminated faction of the above mentioned types.

card.name: Stout Captain
card.text: Command. Playable on a leader. Return any other command cards on the leader to your hand. +1 to the prowess of any faction of the same race in the leader’s current region (+2 in if the faction’s home region). Additionally, the leader may tap to prevent 1 of your factions in his region from participating in a faction battle.

card.name: Strife of War
card.text: Playable during a faction battle (before rolls are made), on a Shadow-land [s] if one of your hero factions is there, or on a Border-land [b] if one of your minion factions is there. Discard if you do not win the faction battle. Target region becomes a Wilderness [w] (place a region card with it). Cannot be duplicated on a given region.

card.name: Subtle Treachery
card.text: Playable on a faction, if you have a revealed agent at his home site in the faction’s current region. Target faction may not move and gives one less mp. If a strike from an attack by this agent fails, place this card in your opponent’s mp; it is worth 4 mp.

card.name: Swift Onset
card.text: Black and grey player only. Mustering card. Your Demon, Dúnadan, Man, Orc, Troll, Undead, and Wolf factions may use region movement and Under-deeps movement.

card.name: The Black Gate Closes
card.text: Grey and white players’ factions cannot moveto Gorgoroth, Imlad Morgul, Nurn and Udûn. Discard when any play deck is exhausted.

card.name: The Dark Captain
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Witch-King of Angmar. Leader. +3 EI against Orc, Troll, and Man factions. May move using starter movement to Orc-holds and Troll-holds. For each faction in his current site’s region, he may control one Ringwraith follower. One such follower may be played at his current site each organization phase. If at a site in one of your factions’ current region, his company may use region movement, but if you have no faction in the region of the company’s site at the beginning of the site phase, replace their site with nearest Darkhaven [K].

card.name: The Doom of Choice
card.text: Wizard player only. Mustering card. Your Dúnadan, Dwarf, Elf, Hobbit and Man factions may use region movement.

card.name: The Enemy Is at Hand
card.text: Factions cannot move through a region that is the current region of a faction of the opposing alignment; they may still move to or from such a region and if their movement through such a region is already declared they must stop in the region. Additionally, garrisonned factions cannot move to or battle in their current region.

card.name: The Enemy Is Moving
card.text: Playable if you have a mustering card in play. Any factions placed under the control of a leader are considered in the region containing the leader’s current site. Such factions are not discarded when the leader moves. The leader may not move more regions than allowed for his factions. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: The Oathbound Army
card.text: Unique. Playable on Army of the Dead, if Aragorn II or Elessar is at a site in its current region. Army of the Dead must move each turn to the region containing Aragorn/Elessar’s current site. The faction may not participate in faction battles. Place this faction in your mp to eliminate an opponent’s faction located in the same region (or at the same site).

card.name: The Whips of Their Masters
card.text: Magic. Spirit-magic. Playable on a faction that can move, if your avatar is in play and can use spirit-magic. Target faction may move 2 extra regions this turn (to no maximum). Unless he is a Ringwraith, your avatar makes a CC modified by -1.

card.name: They Bring Fire
card.text: Playable after a faction battle is declared (before rolls are made). If the battle is at a site, ignore any Battle- ground status of the site. Additionally, you may tap a leader whose current site or region is where the faction battle takes place and discard a Blasting Fire or Liquid Fire he controlls: wound one of opponent’s factions involved in the battle.

card.name: To Breed a War
card.text: Unique. All factions receive a +2 to their prowess in faction battles. Any faction wounded by a faction battle is automatically eliminated.

card.name: To Pass the Archway
card.text: Unique. Black player only. Playable on Minas Titirh if your avatar or War-lord is there. Tap this card if you have factions worth at least 10 mp sieging the site. This card does not untap; discard it if you do not have factions worth 10 mp sieging the site. If tapped, invert this card during your next site phase: all version of Minas Tirith become a Ruins & Lairs [R], are never discarded or returned to the location deck, and this card is worth 6 mp.

card.name: Use and Old Age Accepted
card.text: This card may be taken from your sideboard and shuffledinto your play deck if your opponent has a mustering cardin play. As a permanent event, playable on a faction. Target faction may not move (regardless of conflicting resources). Cannot be duplicated on a faction. As a short event, bring one Muster Disperses from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand and remove this card from the game.

card.name: Vengeance Taken
card.text: Unique. Playable during your opponent’s turn, ifone of your factions is eliminated in a faction battle. Discard one of opponent’s factions that participated in the battle and remove this card from the game. This card cannot be cancelled by any card effect.
